programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 2707504, Title: Cherif, --- Description: Cherif: Created by Lionel Olenga, Stéphane Drouet, Laurent Scalese. The adventures and misadventures of the always-smiling Kader Cherif, Captain of Lyons' Criminal Brigade with an eccentric way to solve the cases, and his by-the-book new partner, Adeline Briard." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2707504/","name":"Cherif","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ4MmVkZmQtYWY3NC00Nzc2LTk3MTgtZWQ4NDQ4MTY2MzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDEwOTk0NTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The adventures and misadventures of the always-smiling Kader Cherif, Captain of Lyons' Criminal Brigade with an eccentric way to solve the cases, and his by-the-book new partner, Adeline Briard.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2707504/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"MACEDAO","dateCreated":"2021-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best","reviewBody":"I just love this serie, is in my top 10 and is wonderful the development of the relationship between Cherif and Adeline, they make me laugh a lot and is pleasant the way Cherif uses humor and tv shows to solve crimes, looking like a light and humored version of CSI that I love too. programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

programme.title: The Rossellinis
Klan Rossellinich
The Rossellinis
programme.desc:
The Rossellinis: Directed by Alessandro Rossellini, Lorenzo d'Amico de Carvalho. With Alessandro Rossellini, Isabella Rossellini, Renzo Rossellini, Roberto Rossellini. This documentary recounts the lives of Roberto Rossellini's children from the perspective of Alessandro Rossellini, the first grandson of the director." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12749696/","name":"The Rossellinis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxOTA1YzItNmIzNS00OGM1LTk5NmEtYmE3YWQwY2E4MTA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ0MjA3Njk@._V1_.jpg","description":"This documentary recounts the lives of Roberto Rossellini's children from the perspective of Alessandro Rossellini, the first grandson of the director.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12749696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nickrogers1969"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fascinating to watch","reviewBody":"This is a very interesting documentary about a big and famous family. The director, who is a grandchild of Roberto Rosselini, has made a loving portrait of his aunts and uncles. The director seems to be a nice and warm person and he has much love for his family living across the world.

My observations about the family after having watched it is that Ingrid Bergman's daughter Ingrid Rosselini is the true beauty of the family. Elletra, Isabella's daughter, would not be working as a model if it were not for her famous mother. The scene with Isabella modelling on the runway with her children is lame.

The scenes of the director with his mother were the most touching in the film and is what stays with me. There seems to be a warm close bond between them despite them not having seen each other for years. This documentary recounts the lives of Roberto Rossellini's children from the perspective of Alessandro Rossellini, the first grandson of the director." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12749696/","name":"The Rossellinis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxOTA1YzItNmIzNS00OGM1LTk5NmEtYmE3YWQwY2E4MTA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ0MjA3Njk@._V1_.jpg","description":"This documentary recounts the lives of Roberto Rossellini's children from the perspective of Alessandro Rossellini, the first grandson of the director.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12749696/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nickrogers1969","dateCreated":"2021-09-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fascinating to watch","reviewBody":"This is a very interesting documentary about a big and famous family. The director, who is a grandchild of Roberto Rosselini, has made a loving portrait of his aunts and uncles. The director seems to be a nice and warm person and he has much love for his family living across the world.

My observations about the family after having watched it is that Ingrid Bergman's daughter Ingrid Rosselini is the true beauty of the family. Elletra, Isabella's daughter, would not be working as a model if it were not for her famous mother. The scene with Isabella modelling on the runway with her children is lame.

The scenes of the director with his mother were the most touching in the film and is what stays with me. There seems to be a warm close bond between them despite them not having seen each other for years. Those scenes were the most hopeful and intimate.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"genre":["Documentary","Biography","History"],"datePublished":"2020-10-26","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1529407/","name":"Alessandro Rossellini","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000618/","name":"Isabella Rossellini","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744022/","name":"Renzo Rossellini"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1529407/","name":"Alessandro Rossellini","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5030454/","name":"Lorenzo d'Amico de Carvalho"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258681/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066197/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0312397/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3324087/","name":"Andrea Paolo Massara","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1529407/","name":"Alessandro Rossellini","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3309810/","name":"Davis Simanis Jr."],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rykoszety
Rykoszety
programme.desc: Rykoszety: Directed by Jakub Radej. With Stanislaw Linowski, Zuzanna Zielinska, Tomasz Schuchardt, Marta Scislowicz. Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. Two coal miner brothers react differently to the oppressive police state. While Tadek prefers to retreat into neutrality, Janek chooses active engagement in the democratic underground. When Janek asks Tadek to store some anti-government leaflets on the second anniversary of Solidarity's 1980 strikes, he triggers a spiral of events that will have everyone's allegiances and characters severely tested." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8658144/","name":"Rykoszety","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc0ZGJlOTUtYWM5NS00MjY3LWE5YzYtNWQxMjYyNDU5NjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. programme.title: Dialogue avec mon jardinier
Rozmowy z moim ogrodnikiem
Dialogue avec mon jardinier
programme.desc:
Dialogue avec mon jardinier: Directed by Jean Becker. With Daniel Auteuil, Jean-Pierre Darroussin, Fanny Cottençon, Alexia Barlier. A successful artist, weary of Parisian life and on the verge of divorce, returns to the country to live in his childhood house. He needs someone to make a real vegetable garden again out of the wilderness it has become. The gardener happens to be a former schoolfriend. A warm, fruitful conversation starts between the two men..." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0825244/","name":"Dialogue avec mon jardinier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNjYmEwZjItY2FkZS00Y2ZhLTliNjMtZmNlYjY5ZjJjMWJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQzMzQzODY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A successful artist, weary of Parisian life and on the verge of divorce, returns to the country to live in his childhood house. He needs someone to make a real vegetable garden again out of the wilderness it has become. The gardener ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0825244/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rajdoctor"},"dateCreated":"2008-07-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Conversation with my Gardener","reviewBody":"I read about this movie, and so deeply interested about the story line that I had to go and watch this flick. I do not understand French, nor the Dutch sub-titles. What I did was tried to search for sub-titles in English on the internet. Could not find one, so downloaded the sub-titles in Spanish, translated them to English and read the whole script of sub-titles before going for the movie. Surely it did not make much sense, but I depended on my memory to recollect the discussions between the painter and the gardener. Coming back home, I again re-read the sub-title script and recollected the images. That is how I saw and understood the movie. Though silly, that was the only and my way of doing enjoying this masterpiece.

The story is simple  a famous painter Dupinceau (Daniel Auteuil) is fed up with life in Paris and has decided to move back to his village home to paint. He hires a gardener Dujardin (Jean-Pierre Darroussin) who turns out to me school class mate. A whole lifetime has passed from where they started at school  remembering a prank the students played on their teacher's birthday cake. They share their journey of life with each other  through casual talks. The painter and gardener both experts in their fields are unique, in their perception of seeing things and understanding. Both of them become close friends  and with ailing health of gardener, the painter takes him to Paris for treatment. A few years later when the gardener dies, the painter fulfills his wishes by drawing the common things of his gardener's life  to capture those memories of happiness and joys.

The simplicity of plot and the depth of discussion is so appealing that one fills fulfilled by just listening the gardener and painter talk  you wish their talk would never end. This inspiring interest is created by Daniel and Jen-Pierre in living their roles perfectly on screen.

Seventy year old Director Jean Becker, who has also partly written the story takes us through this varied journey of life's mysteries without letting us know that.

The innocent wittiness of gardener's amazement and questions posed to the painter are the highlight of the movie  that bring enlightenment of seeing things differently for painter and also for us.

The background musical score is spare, but wherever it is used, it is effective. There are a few sub-plots, but the movie does not digress from the main theme, and kudos to that track.

The most moving scene for me was when the two friends go for fishing, catch a big fish and then leave it back in the water alive and free again. Wonderful! There are so many dialogues in questions, answers and casual exchanges  that resonate with our souls. The last words of the gardener would ring in our hearts for years  I would like that you painted something that I liked. And in the end - the painter does A classic, not to be missed  only recommended for those who are willing to know their souls (Stars 7.25 out fo 10)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3452,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-06-06","keywords":"gardener,divorce,vegetable,love,southern france","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201669/","name":"Jean-Pierre Darroussin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182946/","name":"Fanny Cottençon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030118/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077414/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181924/","name":"Jean Cosmos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2244089/","name":"Henri Cueco"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Both of them become close friends  and with ailing health of gardener, the painter takes him to Paris for treatment. A few years later when the gardener dies, the painter fulfills his wishes by drawing the common things of his gardener's life  to capture those memories of happiness and joys.

The simplicity of plot and the depth of discussion is so appealing that one fills fulfilled by just listening the gardener and painter talk  you wish their talk would never end. This inspiring interest is created by Daniel and Jen-Pierre in living their roles perfectly on screen.

Seventy year old Director Jean Becker, who has also partly written the story takes us through this varied journey of life's mysteries without letting us know that.

The innocent wittiness of gardener's amazement and questions posed to the painter are the highlight of the movie  that bring enlightenment of seeing things differently for painter and also for us.

The background musical score is spare, but wherever it is used, it is effective. There are a few sub-plots, but the movie does not digress from the main theme, and kudos to that track.

The most moving scene for me was when the two friends go for fishing, catch a big fish and then leave it back in the water alive and free again. Wonderful! There are so many dialogues in questions, answers and casual exchanges  that resonate with our souls. The last words of the gardener would ring in our hearts for years  I would like that you painted something that I liked. And in the end - the painter does A classic, not to be missed  only recommended for those who are willing to know their souls (Stars 7.25 out fo 10)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3452,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-06-06","keywords":"gardener,divorce,vegetable,love,southern france","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201669/","name":"Jean-Pierre Darroussin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182946/","name":"Fanny Cottençon"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030118/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077414/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181924/","name":"Jean Cosmos","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2244089/","name":"Henri Cueco"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

The filmmakers take into consideration the totality of the viewer's experience (sights, sounds, emotions, mind). After watching this movie, I felt extremely disturbed with more questions than answers. The audience comes into the movie heavily invested in the story of Enitan and we go through all the heartbreak and humiliation that he experiences. But we don't get to experience the emotional reward of seeing his rehabilitation and moment of self-actualization. It's just presented to us in text towards the end with no explanation of how Ms. Dapo and the others reformed him or what made him come to grips with his identity. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life of others","reviewBody":"World War 2 .. or rather the behind the scenes of everyday life before the mayhem started. Sort of - and with a lot of different individuals and characters to keep us occupied. Many scenes and a lot of German (original language of the movie is polish) being spoken too. Which makes sense of course and I didn't mind, understanding it all.\n\nStories are decent enough and you will care about most people/individuals overall. Drama is there and some will cherish how this was made more than others. It is very well made for sure, the acting is good too. I understand if some rate it higher just because they feel this deserves more than it currently has here on imdb. programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: Jestem tutaj
programme.desc: Niespodziewany przyjazd młodszego brata Stefana (Miłosz Frydrychowicz) zmusza dwudziestoletnią Hanię (Marianna Kowalewska) do zmierzenia się z trudną przeszłością i do odnowy kontaktu z dawno niewidzianą matką. Przez wzgląd na chłopaka dziewczyna musi dać szansę tej skomplikowanej relacji.

W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: Cold in July
Chłód w lipcu
Cold in July
programme.desc:
Cold in July: Directed by Jim Mickle. With Vinessa Shaw, Michael C. Hall, Ken Holmes, Nick Damici. When a protective father meets a murderous ex-con, both need to deviate from the path they are on as they soon find themselves entangled in a downwards spiral of lies and violence while having to confront their own inner psyche." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1179031/","name":"Cold in July","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTU4MTY2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDM5MjQ2MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a protective father meets a murderous ex-con, both need to deviate from the path they are on as they soon find themselves entangled in a downwards spiral of lies and violence while having to confront their own inner psyche.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1179031/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaClown"},"dateCreated":"2014-11-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Endless Orgy Of Twists & Turns That's Definitely Worth A Shot.","reviewBody":"An endless orgy of twists & turns that begins & ends with a bullet being fired, Cold in July isn't an easy film to pin into any genre because it starts as one thing, then changes its course around the middle, seems to be heading in the direction you predicted but once again takes an unexpected turn to become something else entirely.

Set in 1989 Texas, the film tells the story of a local civilian who's all over the news after killing an intruder in self-defence, only to find his family being stalked by the ex-con father of the deceased. However, the two soon find themselves being misled by the police & with the help of a private investigator try to uncover the real truth.

Co-written & directed by Jim Mickle, this indie keeps shifting its gear which stacks up pretty well in the end as the aura of tension that's present in the film throughout its runtime is nerve-wracking. Camera-work is expertly handled, editing is really good, background score nicely compliments the whole narrative & the tone shifts are carried out in a manner that pulls the viewers in than out.

Coming to the performances, the film boasts a badass cast in Michael C. Hall, Sam Shepard & Don Johnson and the trio are fabulous in their given roles. Hall plays an everyman & it is through him that we enter into the story, Shepard chips in with a strong performance as well but it's Don Johnson who impresses the most & steals every scene he's in with effortless finesse.

On an overall scale, Cold in July is a tense, gripping & expertly narrated indie that offers an immersive drama which eventually culminates on a highly satisfying & emotionally rewarding note. Worthy of a wider audience & definitely one of the finest films of the year, not to mention one of the coolest as well, Cold in July is certainly worth a shot & comes highly recommended."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35252,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-12-31","keywords":"based on novel,neo noir,blood,blood splatter,gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2715987225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyODM3ODM5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY4ODI2MTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyODM3ODM5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY4ODI2MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While investigating noises in his house one balmy Texas night in 1989, Richard Dane puts a bullet in the brain of a low-life burglar, Freddy Russell. Although heÂ’s hailed as a small-town hero, Dane soon finds himself fearing for his familyÂ’s safety when FreddyÂ’s ex-con father, Ben, rolls into town - hell-bent on revenge."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355910/","name":"Michael C. Hall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001731/","name":"Sam Shepard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000467/","name":"Don Johnson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0585344/","name":"Jim Mickle"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0481556/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109131/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0298775/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0198804/","name":"Nick Damici"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0585344/","name":"Jim Mickle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0487067/","name":"Joe R. Lansdale"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Carnage Park
Park makabry
Carnage Park
programme.desc: Carnage Park: Directed by Mickey Keating. With Ashley Bell, Pat Healy, James Landry Hébert, Michael Villar. Part crime caper gone awry, part survival horror film, this 1970s set thriller depicts a harrowing fight for survival after a pair of wannabe crooks botch a bank heist and flee into the desert, where they inexplicably stumble upon Carnage Park, a remote stretch of wilderness occupied by a psychotic ex-military sniper." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4335650/","name":"Carnage Park","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3MTA2MTQ0Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzkxNTAwOTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Part crime caper gone awry, part survival horror film, this 1970s set thriller depicts a harrowing fight for survival after a pair of wannabe crooks botch a bank heist and flee into the desert, where they inexplicably stumble upon Ca","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4335650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Fella_shibby"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Boring n unnecessarily lengthy. The shaky cam, flickering lights n blank dark screens will give u headache.","reviewBody":"The movie started well. Killer with a sniper gun. Pat Heally acted like a true psychopath. His facial expressions n accent is good. The deserted highway, bank robbery, hostage, all these gav me hope that this might b another Wolf Creek or another good thriller. I was wrong. The movie went downhill. Inspite of being only around 77 mins, i found the movie very tedious. At times i felt like switching off the movie. The soundtrack is awful. Larry Fessenden is jus there for few mins. Some of the scenes were so badly shot that I felt like turning my face away. Shaky cam, hand held, flickering lights in darkness were too tedious for me. Some scenes jus went blank (dark screen). I don't know what purpose does that serve. So many clichés. 1)When u take down/beat up a villain/creature/psycho, make sure that they r dead or completely down. 2)Whenever the main lead is terrified he/she accidentally stabs a scissor or a knife in an innocent person.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3474,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Crime","Horror"],"datePublished":"2016-07-01","keywords":"survival,game of death,escape,psychopath,psycho killer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1236514585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0NDY0MDI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODIyOTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0NDY0MDI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODIyOTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"It's 1978 and a bank robbery gone wrong leaves Vivian the hostage of two criminals on the run. But things go from bad to off-the-rails berserk when she and her captors wind up on the sun-baked desert outpost of a deranged ex-military sniper, who ensnares them in his deadly game of cat and mouse."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068042/","name":"Ashley Bell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372366/","name":"Pat Healy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2566469/","name":"James Landry Hébert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4806266/","name":"Mickey Keating"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0497026/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4806266/","name":"Mickey Keating"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Alpha House: Directed by Jacob Cooney. With Julien Ari, Heather Paige Cohn, Chris O'Brien, Jean Louise O'Sullivan. When two freshmen pledges are accepted into the biggest party frat on campus (ALPHA HOUSE), they think they have it all. That is, until the assistant dean forces the Alphas to share their house with a sorority or face expulsion from school. Not wanting to see their lifelong dream of becoming Alphas destroyed, the pledges convince the other members of the house to take back what's theirs, waging an epic battle of the sexes to fight for their right to party." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3307774/","name":"Alpha House","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5ODY2ODI0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzU3NTgwMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When two freshmen pledges are accepted into the biggest party frat on campus (ALPHA HOUSE), they think they have it all. That is, until the assistant dean forces the Alphas to share their house with a sorority or face expulsion from ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3307774/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"NinjaXCV"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not bad if you don't have high hopes","reviewBody":"The story is not only cliche but just plain unbelievable. But if you're just expecting some cheesey entertainment and great nude scenes, then this is worth a watch.

It's like Anerican Pie meets Animal House with less laughs and more boobs.

The writers obviously were never part of a fraternity and may have never gone to college by they way they portray college life and rules that govern them. On top of that the plans that the guys and girls execute to get back at each other don't even make sense. You won't understand what the goal or their plan was. But its all an excuse to show some good nude scenes. And the women are gorgeous. programme.title: Beer League
Liga piwoszy
Beer League
programme.desc:
Beer League: Directed by Frank Sebastiano. With Artie Lange, Ralph Macchio, Anthony DeSando, Cara Buono. An unemployed slacker inspires his softball teammates to improve their game so they won't get kicked out of the local league." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0453453/","name":"Beer League","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3MTU2MDY2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjc0ODUzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unemployed slacker inspires his softball teammates to improve their game so they won't get kicked out of the local league.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0453453/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ramsfan"},"dateCreated":"2009-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good way to kill an hour and a half","reviewBody":"It's amazing when people get on a website and rip a movie like "Beer League" as if they were expecting "Citizen Kane" when they went to the movies. Beer League involves the heated rivalry between two men's softball teams in New Jersey; Ed's Beer and Swill (featuring Artie Lange, Ralph Macchio and assorted others) and Manganelli Construction, a four time league champion. After yet another collective trip to the police station following a brawl, it is decided the team with the worst record between the two at season's end will be thrown out of the league. Lange & Company band together and show resolve to reach the title game vs.Manganelli. Guess who wins? 

I thought the movie was funny- even hilarious in spots. Beer League never tries to be anything other than what it is; a bawdy comedy with plenty of crude humor, sexual misconduct and vulgarity. Little was required in the acting department, as Lange is essentially playing himself. Fans of his stand-up act and Howard Stern appearances will not be disappointed. There are welcome cameos by Sopranos bit player Frank Pellegrino and series regular Joseph Gannascoli. And Seymour Cassel turns in a great performance as the team's old, foul-mouthed pitcher, Dirt.

Lange's real life drug and alcohol use- parodied and boasted about in nearly everything he does- will hopefully not have tragic consequences as it has for so many others in the world of comedy. This movie works, however, and is good for a few belly laughs along the way.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Sport"],"datePublished":"2006-09-15","keywords":"adult son lives with his mother,adult child lives with mother,softball,baseball,beer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Beer League","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3015246105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMyYjNjMzUtZTllOC00OTM3LTg0MjMtNDg3ZThlZmUzODRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMyYjNjMzUtZTllOC00OTM3LTg0MjMtNDg3ZThlZmUzODRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Echo Bridge Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005119/","name":"Artie Lange"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001494/","name":"Ralph Macchio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0220867/","name":"Anthony DeSando"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780980/","name":"Frank Sebastiano"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135558/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0232025/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0166069/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780980/","name":"Frank Sebastiano"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005119/","name":"Artie Lange"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Polar Opposites
Bieguny śmierci
Polar Opposites
programme.desc:
Polar Opposites: Directed by Fred Olen Ray. With Charles Shaughnessy, Tracy Nelson, Ken Barnett, Beth Grant. David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1172069/","name":"Polar Opposites","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMDg0MTQwNjReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDkyNTI2ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1172069/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SciVortex"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Science-Fact Rocks the World","reviewBody":"If you're expecting a splashy, big-budget Hollywood disaster flick, you should stick to "The Day After Tomorrow" or "Deep Impact." "Polar Opposites" strength does NOT come from million dollar fx, or performances by academy-award-winning actors. The thing that makes this low-budget independent film so engaging is the story and the relationships that develop while the story world unravels on screen.

At its simplest, "Polar Opposites" spins a tale about a possible global disaster set in motion by a nuclear blast, and how a scientist is called upon to save the day. The scientific theories proposed by the story are chillingly accurate, and they are what hooked me initially. It's refreshing to see science-fact made understandable and yes, entertaining (the tangerine/battery visual was funny). But the film goes beyond simply laying out facts and ideas to tell the story. It puts together a group of characters that have real issues in dealing with the problem, and with each other. There is a father/son relationship (Charles Shaunessy and Clive Revill) that is touching and real, funny and even corny at times. Tracey Nelson and Kieren Hutchinson play doctors coping with the crisis, but they still have a playful side to their relationship. And the actor playing their patient, Al (Ismael Carlo), is both unsettling and tender.

In the end, the disaster unfolds like it might in any other disaster flick (although, as I mentioned, without the huge big budget fx). But the story and the characters were the ingredient that actually made the film quite enjoyable.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-06-06","keywords":"nuclear test,friendship,scientist,writer,earthquake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deadly Shift","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi887948825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Ground Zero: The Deady Shift aka Polar Opposites"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0789478/","name":"Charles Shaughnessy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0625796/","name":"Tracy Nelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1757373/","name":"Ken Barnett"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0676248/","name":"Fred Olen Ray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167713/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563701/","name":"Paolo Mazzucato"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Thousand Kisses Deep
Tysiąc pocałunków w głąb
A Thousand Kisses Deep
programme.desc:
A Thousand Kisses Deep: Directed by Dana Lustig. With Emilia Fox, Jodie Whittaker, David Warner, Dougray Scott. An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1565069/","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMDQzNDA5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDQyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1565069/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rooprect"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"They always fall for the trumpet player","reviewBody":"In case you're wondering, yes, "A Thousand Kisses Deep" takes its name as well as its somber mood from the 2001 Leonard Cohen song "A Thousand Kisses Deep". But for Cohen fans, I don't remember hearing the song in the film, only the lyrics spoken at the beginning and end. So, much like the movie "Starman" which does not have the Bowie song, it's a bit of a bummer.

If you can get past that, no problem.

The film itself is like a blend of "The Lake House", "The Time Traveler's Wife" and "Sleeping with the Enemy" with maybe a dash of "Angel Heart" with its sexuality and diabolical symbolism. It takes a deliberately fragmented, psueudo-supernatural approach, challenging the viewer like in "The Lake House". It features a character traveling through time like in "The Time Traveler's Wife", and it revolves around a quietly abusive relationship between a man & a woman like in "Sleeping with the Enemy". Throw them all together and mix vigorously with a dash of very nice jazz trumpet music, and there you have "A Thousand Kisses Deep".

It is NOT a "science fiction" as I've read in some places (why do people see "time travel" and immediately think HG Welles and Star Trek??). And it's definitely not a "romance", unless your idea of romance includes borderline rape, borderline paedophilia and something even worse which I won't ruin for you. It's not a straightforward thriller because there's not really any terror. So this film is pretty hard to classify except to say that it's the story of a woman who is trying to fix her past, present and future before it ends in disaster.

By the way, although I just threw a bunch of spooky themes at you (rape, paedophilia, etc), don't worry because the film is not explicit or graphic in any way. It implies a lot of things, but I don't think there's any nudity other than Jodie Whittaker's backside shown through a closet door. This subtle style of filmmaking is prevalent in the whole movie, which means there aren't a lot of melodramatic clichés or people shouting & breaking things. What's funny is that the *lack* of action/violence makes the film even more sinister to me.

Another interesting spin is the way the story is very dreamlike--symbolic and metaphoric rather than realistic--so you don't get caught up analyzing plot details. For example, the time traveler is never recognized by any of the other characters even though you'd think they would. Also, settings don't change either, and although some characters age expectedly, others stay the same. It sets an interesting tone, as if telling us (like a dream) that certain appearances are not as important as their meaning.

This is director Dana Lustig's latest film credit (as of 2014), and I hope there are many more to come. It is one of the rare thrillers with a female perspective which I (a guy) find so much more provocative than the standard Hollywood thrillers about some dude who's steamrolling through the story trying to be cool. "A Thousand Kisses Deep" has just enough enough pauses for reflection while maintaining its momentum. Definitely give this a whirl if you're looking for a movie that's pensive yet provocative and certainly different from all the rest.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Romance","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2012-06-15","keywords":"four word title,title directed by female,written by director,female protagonist,abusive boyfriend","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1763615513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for A Thousand Kisses Deep"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0288976/","name":"Emilia Fox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092886/","name":"Jodie Whittaker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001831/","name":"David Warner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527325/","name":"Dana Lustig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0293122/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0476384/","name":"Alex Kustanovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3730130/","name":"Vadim Moldovan"}],"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 96 Minutes
96 minut
96 Minutes
programme.desc: 96 Minutes: Directed by Aimee Lagos. With Christian Serratos, Brittany Snow, David Oyelowo, Evan Ross. The story of 4 lives slammed together in a shocking moment. Intercutting between a carjacking and the separate stories of the 4 kids in Atlanta, we watch as they hurtle toward a life-changing end." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1641385/","name":"96 Minutes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNjQ2ODM5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTM3NDk1Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of 4 lives slammed together in a shocking moment. Intercutting between a carjacking and the separate stories of the 4 kids in Atlanta, we watch as they hurtle toward a life-changing end.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1641385/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cosmo_tiger"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":""Crash" with teens. I liked it much more then I expected to. Pretty emotional and powerful. A good watch. I say B+","reviewBody":""I never should have gotten out of bed this morning." Carley (Snow) is about to graduate from college and her father isn't interested in attending. Lena (Serratos) just found out that her boyfriend is cheating on her. Dre (Ross) just found out that he will be able to graduate high school and finally has found a way out of gang life. Kevin (Trautmann) wants nothing more then to join a gang. When him and Dre get into an argument that ends up in carjacking the car that belongs to Carley with Lena has a passenger. The best way to describe this is "Crash" with teens. Total strangers who are all connected by one event that threatens to ruin all of them. This is very moving, powerful and intense. I highly recommend this one but much like "Crash" it's not really one you can watch over and over. The acting is great and the movie is a mix of flashbacks and current events that really make you feel connected to the characters and find your self sad and angry all at once. Overall, a surprisingly good movie that deserves to be watched. I give it a B+","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2011-10-14","keywords":"child with a gun,shooting a woman,woman in jeopardy,carjacking,atlanta georgia","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"96 Minutes","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1981719321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYxODE0MmItMmIwOC00NjQyLWFlYzEtNDVhNWNmM2M2MmNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYxODE0MmItMmIwOC00NjQyLWFlYzEtNDVhNWNmM2M2MmNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for 96 Minutes"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0811242/","name":"Brittany Snow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1963091/","name":"Evan Ross"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2759438/","name":"Sharon Conley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1350938/","name":"Aimee Lagos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0276411/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0321415/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0193456/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1350938/","name":"Aimee Lagos"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cold in July
Chłód w lipcu
Cold in July
programme.desc:
Cold in July: Directed by Jim Mickle. With Vinessa Shaw, Michael C. Hall, Ken Holmes, Nick Damici. When a protective father meets a murderous ex-con, both need to deviate from the path they are on as they soon find themselves entangled in a downwards spiral of lies and violence while having to confront their own inner psyche." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1179031/","name":"Cold in July","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTU4MTY2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDM5MjQ2MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a protective father meets a murderous ex-con, both need to deviate from the path they are on as they soon find themselves entangled in a downwards spiral of lies and violence while having to confront their own inner psyche.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1179031/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaClown"},"dateCreated":"2014-11-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Endless Orgy Of Twists & Turns That's Definitely Worth A Shot.","reviewBody":"An endless orgy of twists & turns that begins & ends with a bullet being fired, Cold in July isn't an easy film to pin into any genre because it starts as one thing, then changes its course around the middle, seems to be heading in the direction you predicted but once again takes an unexpected turn to become something else entirely.

Set in 1989 Texas, the film tells the story of a local civilian who's all over the news after killing an intruder in self-defence, only to find his family being stalked by the ex-con father of the deceased. However, the two soon find themselves being misled by the police & with the help of a private investigator try to uncover the real truth.

Co-written & directed by Jim Mickle, this indie keeps shifting its gear which stacks up pretty well in the end as the aura of tension that's present in the film throughout its runtime is nerve-wracking. Camera-work is expertly handled, editing is really good, background score nicely compliments the whole narrative & the tone shifts are carried out in a manner that pulls the viewers in than out.

Coming to the performances, the film boasts a badass cast in Michael C. Hall, Sam Shepard & Don Johnson and the trio are fabulous in their given roles. Hall plays an everyman & it is through him that we enter into the story, Shepard chips in with a strong performance as well but it's Don Johnson who impresses the most & steals every scene he's in with effortless finesse.

On an overall scale, Cold in July is a tense, gripping & expertly narrated indie that offers an immersive drama which eventually culminates on a highly satisfying & emotionally rewarding note. Worthy of a wider audience & definitely one of the finest films of the year, not to mention one of the coolest as well, Cold in July is certainly worth a shot & comes highly recommended."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35252,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-12-31","keywords":"based on novel,neo noir,blood,blood splatter,gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2715987225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyODM3ODM5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY4ODI2MTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyODM3ODM5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY4ODI2MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While investigating noises in his house one balmy Texas night in 1989, Richard Dane puts a bullet in the brain of a low-life burglar, Freddy Russell. Although heÂ’s hailed as a small-town hero, Dane soon finds himself fearing for his familyÂ’s safety when FreddyÂ’s ex-con father, Ben, rolls into town - hell-bent on revenge."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355910/","name":"Michael C. Hall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001731/","name":"Sam Shepard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000467/","name":"Don Johnson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0585344/","name":"Jim Mickle"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0481556/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109131/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0298775/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0198804/","name":"Nick Damici"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0585344/","name":"Jim Mickle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0487067/","name":"Joe R. Lansdale"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Camera-work is expertly handled, editing is really good, background score nicely compliments the whole narrative & the tone shifts are carried out in a manner that pulls the viewers in than out.

Coming to the performances, the film boasts a badass cast in Michael C. Hall, Sam Shepard & Don Johnson and the trio are fabulous in their given roles. Hall plays an everyman & it is through him that we enter into the story, Shepard chips in with a strong performance as well but it's Don Johnson who impresses the most & steals every scene he's in with effortless finesse.

On an overall scale, Cold in July is a tense, gripping & expertly narrated indie that offers an immersive drama which eventually culminates on a highly satisfying & emotionally rewarding note. Worthy of a wider audience & definitely one of the finest films of the year, not to mention one of the coolest as well, Cold in July is certainly worth a shot & comes highly recommended.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35252,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-12-31","keywords":"based on novel,neo noir,blood,blood splatter,gun","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2715987225","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyODM3ODM5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY4ODI2MTE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyODM3ODM5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY4ODI2MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While investigating noises in his house one balmy Texas night in 1989, Richard Dane puts a bullet in the brain of a low-life burglar, Freddy Russell. programme.title: The Girl
Ziemia jałowa
The Rise
programme.desc: The Girl: Directed by Julian Jarrold. With Sienna Miller, Toby Jones, Imelda Staunton, Conrad Kemp. The turbulent relationship between filmmaker Sir Alfred Hitchcock (Toby Jones) and actress Tippi Hedren (Sienna Miller)." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2132485/","name":"The Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0NzA4MDU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTE2Mzg1OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The turbulent relationship between filmmaker Sir Alfred Hitchcock (Toby Jones) and actress Tippi Hedren (Sienna Miller).","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2132485/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Cinetech"},"dateCreated":"2012-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"An important note about this film.....","reviewBody":"Probably all of this film is a complete lie, but in all of the reviews both internal and external, the critics have overlooked an amazing thing that seems to have gone unnoticed by most....The actor portraying Hitchcock is wearing flawless silicone gel filled prosthetics over almost every inch of his face and neck...he doesn't look exactly like Hitchcock, but the prosthetics are blended flawlessly and are truly believable. The film itself is completely ridiculous, and anyone who would believe that Tippi Hedren was actually being tortured by birds in take after take is either very simple minded or has no idea as to the way films are actually made...Tippi Hedren was a lukewarm actress who was angry that she could never get work after these films and has convinced herself that it must have been Hitch who was behind her failure, when it was actually the simple fact that she wasn't very good at all."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6854,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-20","keywords":"bird,model,blonde,director,actress","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0429363/","name":"Toby Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001767/","name":"Imelda Staunton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0418982/","name":"Julian Jarrold"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176427/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044704/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400634/","name":"Gwyneth Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0819488/","name":"Donald Spoto"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz
Outpost: Front wschodni
Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz
programme.desc: Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz: Directed by Kieran Parker. With Bryan Larkin, Iván Kamarás, Velibor Topic, Laurentiu Possa. In this third installment of the hit Nazi Zombie action horror movie, Outpost: Rise Of The Spetnaz, we discover the horrifying origins of these supernatural soldiers and see them in ferocious gladiatorial battle against the most ruthless and notorious of all military special forces: the Russian Spetsnaz." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2241403/","name":"Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4NzAwODEwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTMwNTQ2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this third installment of the hit Nazi Zombie action horror movie, Outpost: Rise Of The Spetnaz, we discover the horrifying origins of these supernatural soldiers and see them in ferocious gladiatorial battle against the most ruth","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2241403/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hobgoblinlol"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable","reviewBody":"Honestly, don't know why it got 4.2 in my opinion the movie at least deserves 5.0-6.0 yes it is a cheesy sci-fi plot, but I think it is well executed. The thing I love about Outpost movies is the atmosphere and even though I think that the film took an odd turn by going back to WW2 to have an origin story it was still well done. But we can all see that the budget of the movie isn't completely as good as the first Outpost. The acting is decent and the action is good. Plot and the story maybe little bit too cheesy, but it's a Nazi zombie sci-fi flick so what do you expect? god father? I'm actually surprised with the stern treatment Outpost movies receive. Not to mention when people call ''Dead Snow'' good it's just eerie. Even Frankenstein's army has 5.0 than this considering the fact that it is not as good. War of the dead has 4.0 even though it's not an awful disaster. This one actually had some cameos and references from the previous films including the Beethoven song that starts randomly playing once in a while in all three films (very good touch in my opinion) as far as I am concerned the movie is definitely a 5.0 - 6.0/10. It wouldn't hurt to let the logic fly out and enjoy a cheesy flick that can grant you certain entertainment.\n\nIMDb and Rotten Tomatoes logic: if it's not a masterpiece, it's bad. Even though IMDb is a saint compared to Rotten Tomatoes. Hopefully, when more people vote it'll at least get the rating of 5.0","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2276,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2013-06-27","keywords":"zombie,underground facility,escape,prisoner,ss officer","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1385922/","name":"Bryan Larkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436442/","name":"Iván Kamarás"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0867677/","name":"Velibor Topic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662404/","name":"Kieran Parker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197375/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0428412/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2361978/","name":"Rae Brunton"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Dark Tower
The Dark Mile
programme.desc:
The Dark Tower: Directed by Nikolaj Arcel. With Matthew McConaughey, Idris Elba, Tom Taylor, Dennis Haysbert. A boy haunted by visions of a dark tower from a parallel reality teams up with the tower's disillusioned guardian to stop an evil warlock known as the Man in Black who plans to use the boy to destroy the tower and open the gates of Hell." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1648190/","name":"The Dark Tower","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3MjUwMzQ3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjcwNjkxMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy haunted by visions of a dark tower from a parallel reality teams up with the tower's disillusioned guardian to stop an evil warlock known as the Man in Black who plans to use the boy to destroy the tower and open the gates of H","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1648190/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wileyschmitt"},"dateCreated":"2017-08-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"No Expectations = Enjoyable Experience","reviewBody":"I've been looking forward to seeing this movie for a few years, I've read all the books including the more recent one ('The Wind Thru the Keyhole') and other books that Walter appeared in. It's currently 2017, and anyone who hasn't learned the 'book to movie' lesson by now needs to finally learn it so that they can also enjoy movies what they are, which is an extra bonus for a book that is well liked by a lot of people. If the movie actually turns out good than all the better, but being more realistic about movies not having to live up to the books they're based on is best thing to do so you don't end up like the rest of these bitter people who leave the movie theater as quickly as possible just to come back home and write a 'nerd'tastic negative one starred review expressing all their deep down inner angst in the most pathetic form possible. Luckily I beat many of them to the punch before they tore this fun and entertaining movie apart, and I did find it entertaining thanx to having zero expectations about it, go ahead and try it next time you go to a similar movie, you'll at least temporarily enjoy yourself. Whining and complaining about trivial things isn't good for you or anyone else anyways.

I thought they did a fairly good job considering all the various challenges that this potential movie presented them, and the fact that it at one point seemed like it may never even get released or get just get much further delayed didn't make the project seem as promising as it did when first hearing about it's production a few years back for the first time. I got my expectations up very high when I first heard about it, but as time went on I would settle for just about anything decent, and 'decent' it sure was, though I'll rate the movie a 10 to make up for one or two reviews from the Negative Nancys of IMDb. I'm happy to see that Sony left this open for a sequel, It's still not a for sure thing if they'll make another, though King seems to think they will, but I'd pay a lot of money to see a movie based of the backstory from 'Wizard and Glass'.

Bottom line: Have fun, it's a fun movie whether you have read the books or not. Not a bad choice for the kids either, lot of action, no nudity, and not much cussing from what I recall, (12+ is my guess depending on who you are, ratings can be deceiving).

If you haven't read the books: Read them if you're an avid reader, you won't regret it, but if you're just an average reader then the 8 books will take you far too long to get thru and you'll probably give up and have wasted a lot of time trying. One trick is just to be disciplined enough to read every single day if possible, and it doesn't even have to be much because it will add up over the course of year, and if you were to read 10 - 15 pages per day every day you'd be able to finish 'The Dark Tower' series within one year. (Quick easy formula: 365 days per year, very roughly 365 pages per book, so 5 pages per day will get you thru 5 books per year, and not difficult at all to make that 40 pages per day, and at the end of the year you will have read 40 BOOKS! Probably more books than you've ready in your life, just got to form the habit first and go from there, keep track with a notebook to stay disciplined if you have to). 

Other King suggestions: 'The Shining' Even better than the movie, and possibly underrated because of the movie's popularity, and the fact most people are too lazy to read. 

'The Eyes of the Dragon' Walter is a main character, and King once again digs into the darkness of the man's psyche while weaving a great story in Medieval times. 

'The Stand' The ultimate apocalyptic adventure with Walter doing what he does best, and the fate of the lives of dozens of different characters all linked to Walter thru their dreams of him, and has 1000 or so pages to all find each other and come together to somehow stop him while avoiding much betrayal and many obstacles along the beaten path that is led and aided by their other dreams of another character who is out to help them find where they need to be going. 

'Different Seasons' No, it's not a story about a possessed spice rack) This book includes four novellas (short novels). Most of you will recognize of 2 or 3 of the others as those were all turned into good movies ('The Shawshank Redemption' 'Apt Pupil' and 'The Body' AKA 'Stand By Me'), and just as is usually the case are far superior to the films, and not that the films are bad at all. 

It's just the reality that books always beat movies, it's no contest at all, but movies are a time for us to do something unproductive and be happy while doing it. So don't be like these sad saps who would actually pay for a movie knowing very well that they'll not have a good time. One of the secrets to life is 'to have a good time when you're able to', and if you like to laugh at bad movies that are trying to be serious then you need to finally get yourself on the MST3K and Rifftrax bandwagon.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134154,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2017-08-04","keywords":"gunslinger,based on novel,prophetic dream,another world,parallel dimension","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1690417433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxNTk3NjgxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAyMDY4MjI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxNTk3NjgxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAyMDY4MjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Gunslinger, Roland Deschain, roams an Old West-like landscape where "the world has moved on" in pursuit of the man in black. Also searching for the fabled Dark Tower, in the hopes that reaching it will preserve his dying world."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252961/","name":"Idris Elba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6999211/","name":"Tom Taylor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1064048/","name":"Nikolaj Arcel"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026545/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0194736/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326040/","name":"Akiva Goldsman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684374/","name":"Jeff Pinkner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421314/","name":"Anders Thomas Jensen"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

Luckily I beat many of them to the punch before they tore this fun and entertaining movie apart, and I did find it entertaining thanx to having zero expectations about it, go ahead and try it next time you go to a similar movie, you'll at least temporarily enjoy yourself. Whining and complaining about trivial things isn't good for you or anyone else anyways.

I thought they did a fairly good job considering all the various challenges that this potential movie presented them, and the fact that it at one point seemed like it may never even get released or get just get much further delayed didn't make the project seem as promising as it did when first hearing about it's production a few years back for the first time. I got my expectations up very high when I first heard about it, but as time went on I would settle for just about anything decent, and 'decent' it sure was, though I'll rate the movie a 10 to make up for one or two reviews from the Negative Nancys of IMDb. I'm happy to see that Sony left this open for a sequel, It's still not a for sure thing if they'll make another, though King seems to think they will, but I'd pay a lot of money to see a movie based of the backstory from 'Wizard and Glass'.

Bottom line: Have fun, it's a fun movie whether you have read the books or not. Not a bad choice for the kids either, lot of action, no nudity, and not much cussing from what I recall, (12+ is my guess depending on who you are, ratings can be deceiving).

If you haven't read the books: Read them if you're an avid reader, you won't regret it, but if you're just an average reader then the 8 books will take you far too long to get thru and you'll probably give up and have wasted a lot of time trying. One trick is just to be disciplined enough to read every single day if possible, and it doesn't even have to be much because it will add up over the course of year, and if you were to read 10 - 15 pages per day every day you'd be able to finish 'The Dark Tower' series within one year. (Quick easy formula: 365 days per year, very roughly 365 pages per book, so 5 pages per day will get you thru 5 books per year, and not difficult at all to make that 40 pages per day, and at the end of the year you will have read 40 BOOKS! Probably more books than you've ready in your life, just got to form the habit first and go from there, keep track with a notebook to stay disciplined if you have to). 

Other King suggestions: 'The Shining' Even better than the movie, and possibly underrated because of the movie's popularity, and the fact most people are too lazy to read. 

'The Eyes of the Dragon' Walter is a main character, and King once again digs into the darkness of the man's psyche while weaving a great story in Medieval times. 

'The Stand' The ultimate apocalyptic adventure with Walter doing what he does best, and the fate of the lives of dozens of different characters all linked to Walter thru their dreams of him, and has 1000 or so pages to all find each other and come together to somehow stop him while avoiding much betrayal and many obstacles along the beaten path that is led and aided by their other dreams of another character who is out to help them find where they need to be going. 

'Different Seasons' No, it's not a story about a possessed spice rack) This book includes four novellas (short novels). Most of you will recognize of 2 or 3 of the others as those were all turned into good movies ('The Shawshank Redemption' 'Apt Pupil' and 'The Body' AKA 'Stand By Me'), and just as is usually the case are far superior to the films, and not that the films are bad at all. 

It's just the reality that books always beat movies, it's no contest at all, but movies are a time for us to do something unproductive and be happy while doing it. So don't be like these sad saps who would actually pay for a movie knowing very well that they'll not have a good time. One of the secrets to life is 'to have a good time when you're able to', and if you like to laugh at bad movies that are trying to be serious then you need to finally get yourself on the MST3K and Rifftrax bandwagon.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134154,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2017-08-04","keywords":"gunslinger,based on novel,prophetic dream,another world,parallel dimension","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1690417433","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxNTk3NjgxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAyMDY4MjI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxNTk3NjgxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAyMDY4MjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Gunslinger, Roland Deschain, roams an Old West-like landscape where "the world has moved on" in pursuit of the man in black. programme.title: Remember Me
Twój na zawsze
Remember Me
programme.desc:
Remember Me: Directed by Allen Coulter. With Caitlyn Rund, Moisés Acevedo, Noel Rodriguez, Kevin P. McCarthy. A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1403981/","name":"Remember Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTA4MTg1ODkwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzE5ODAxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403981/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Southerngiftsu"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Same movie as pro critics?","reviewBody":"I walked away from the movie, Remember Me, asking myself one question. Did I just see the same movie I have heard several professional movie critics review negatively or indifferently? The first review I read online for Remember Me was that it was trite, predictable, and drawn out. (Bull, I say.) The responses of those around me in the theater today proved those claims false as well. I saw people laughing, gasping, wincing, and weeping. I saw the audience RELATING.

The characters are multi-dimensional and the acting is fantastic. This movie was not just feel-good fluff. It was not a platform to showcase Brosnan and Pattinson as eye candy. It was thought-provoking and intense. The characters were brooding, wounded, lovable and believable. The movie's twist was unique and effective.

If you want to see an enjoyable movie that will challenge your emotions and leave you feeling appropriately introspective, Remember Me fits the bills perfectly. (And there is nothing at all wrong with the added eye-candy benefit! ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":142953,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-03-31","keywords":"new york,new york city,binge drinking,september 11 2001,year 1991","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1472839961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500155/","name":"Robert Pattinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211087/","name":"Emilie de Ravin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3533310/","name":"Caitlyn Rund"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002339/","name":"Allen Coulter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3391497/","name":"Will Fetters"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="
